qas.question: What is the BeiDou Navigation Satellite System named after?
What is the Big Dipper constellation known as in Chinese?
What was the Běidǒu constellation used for?

answers.text: to locate the North Star Polaris

qas.question: Which Satellite System is named after the Little Dipper?
What is the Big Dipper constellation known as in Japanese?

plausible_answers.text: to locate the North Star Polaris

qas.question: What was the Little Dipper constellation used for?
Ancient anthropologists named the constellation what?

context: The official English name of the system is <b5_0>BeiDou Navigation Satellite System<b5_0/>. It is named after <a0_0>the Big Dipper constellation<a0_0/>, which is known in Chinese as <a1_0><b6_0><b9_0>Běidǒu<b9_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>. The name literally means "<a2_0><b7_0>Northern Dipper<b7_0/><a2_0/>", the name given by <a3_0>ancient Chinese astronomers<a3_0/> to the seven brightest stars of the Ursa Major constellation. Historically, this set of stars was used in navigation <a4_0><b8_0>to locate the North Star Polaris<b8_0/><a4_0/>. As such, the name BeiDou also serves as a metaphor for the purpose of the satellite navigation system.
